name: Aluminum
description: A lightweight metal commonly used in beverage cans, foil, and some electronic components.

name: Glass
description: Material used in bottles, jars, and some construction materials; can be recycled multiple times without losing quality.

name: Plastic
description: Polyethylene terephthalate, commonly used in single-use water bottles and food containers. Known for its high recyclability.

name: Cardboard
description: Paper-based material commonly used for packaging; biodegradable but often treated to increase durability.

name: Steel
description: Durable metal used in construction, packaging, and appliances; can be recycled indefinitely.

name: Textiles (Cotton)
description: Natural fiber used in clothing and household items; biodegradable but requires substantial resources to produce.

name: Wood
description: Biodegradable material used in furniture, construction, and packaging; can be composted if untreated.

name: Copper
description: Conductive metal used in electrical wiring and plumbing; has a high recycling value.

name: Leather
description: Material made from animal hides, used in clothing and accessories; biodegradable but has a high production impact.

name: Concrete
description: Common construction material made from cement, sand, and gravel; has a high carbon footprint during production.

name: Bamboo
description: Fast-growing natural resource used in furniture and flooring; renewable and biodegradable.

name: Ceramics
description: Durable material used in dishes, tiles, and pottery; not biodegradable but can last for a long time without degrading.

name: Wool
description: Natural fiber obtained from sheep, used in clothing and insulation; biodegradable but requires resources for animal care.

name: Glass Fiber
description: Reinforced glass used in insulation and industrial applications; not biodegradable and difficult to recycle.

name: Gypsum
description: Mineral used in drywall and cement; can be recycled in construction, but not biodegradable.

name: Brass
description: An alloy of copper and zinc used in plumbing, musical instruments, and hardware; recyclable and durable.

name: Paper
description: Widely used for writing, printing, and packaging; biodegradable and recyclable but has environmental costs in production.

name: Carbon Fiber
description: Lightweight, high-strength material used in aerospace and automotive industries; challenging to recycle.

name: Tin
description: Metal used in coatings, soldering, and food containers; recyclable but limited availability.

name: Asphalt
description: Petroleum-based material used in road construction; can be recycled but has a high environmental impact.

name: Gold
description: Precious metal used in jewelry, electronics, and coins; highly recyclable but mining has significant environmental impact.

name: Nickel
description: Metal used in batteries, coins, and stainless steel; recyclable but has an environmental impact in mining.

name: Linoleum
description: Biodegradable flooring material made from natural materials like linseed oil; low impact but limited recyclability.

name: Polypropylene
description: Plastic used in packaging, automotive parts, and textiles; recyclable but non-biodegradable.

name: Neoprene
description: Synthetic rubber used in wetsuits, medical braces, and electrical insulation; challenging to recycle and non-biodegradable.

name: Polycarbonate
description: Durable plastic used in eyewear, CDs, and electronics; non-biodegradable but recyclable under certain conditions.

name: Silk
description: Natural fiber produced by silkworms, used in textiles; biodegradable but production involves animal resources.

name: Titanium
description: Lightweight, corrosion-resistant metal used in medical implants and aerospace; recyclable but energy-intensive to produce.

name: Burlap
description: Natural fiber made from jute, used in sacks and crafts; biodegradable and low impact.

name: Graphite
description: Mineral used in pencils, batteries, and as a lubricant; recyclable but limited supply.

name: Foam Rubber
description: Synthetic material used in mattresses and cushions; non-biodegradable and challenging to recycle.

name: Plywood
description: Engineered wood product used in construction and furniture; biodegradable but may contain adhesives.

name: Lead
description: Heavy metal used in batteries and radiation shielding; highly toxic and challenging to recycle safely.

name: Polyester
description: Synthetic fiber used in textiles; non-biodegradable and releases microplastics.

name: Asbestos
description: Mineral used for insulation; highly toxic and non-biodegradable, banned in many countries.

name: Slate
description: Natural stone used in roofing and flooring; durable and recyclable but resource-intensive to quarry.

name: Synthetic Rubber
description: Material used in tires and various industrial products; non-biodegradable and challenging to recycle.

name: Cork
description: Natural material harvested from cork oak trees, used in bottle stoppers and flooring; biodegradable and renewable.

name: Sawdust
description: Wood waste product often used in particleboard and as a fuel source; biodegradable and can be repurposed.

name: Vermiculite
description: Mineral used in insulation and horticulture; renewable but has environmental costs in mining.

name: Fiberglass Insulation
description: Material used in building insulation; non-biodegradable and may release harmful fibers.

name: Recycled Plastic (RPET)
description: Plastic derived from recycled PET bottles; recyclable but still has environmental costs in processing.

name: Charcoal
description: Carbon-rich material used as fuel and for filtration; renewable but can contribute to deforestation if unsustainably sourced.

name: Aluminum Foil
description: Thin sheet of aluminum used in food packaging and insulation; recyclable but often discarded after single use.

name: Bioplastic
description: Plastic alternative made from biological substances, such as corn starch; compostable in industrial facilities.

name: Nylon
description: Synthetic fiber used in textiles and engineering; non-biodegradable and produces microplastics.

name: Melamine
description: Hard plastic used in dishware and furniture; non-biodegradable and difficult to recycle.

name: Cast Iron
description: Heavy metal used in cookware and construction; recyclable and long-lasting.

name: Organic Cotton
description: Cotton grown without synthetic pesticides; biodegradable but still resource-intensive.

name: Recycled Paper
description: Paper made from previously used paper products; biodegradable and reduces the need for new raw materials.

name: Synthetic Leather
description: Plastic-based leather alternative; non-biodegradable but reduces demand for animal-based leather.

name: Kevlar
description: High-strength synthetic fiber used in protective gear and automotive parts; non-biodegradable and hard to recycle.

name: Galvanized Steel
description: Steel coated with zinc to prevent corrosion; recyclable but resource-intensive to produce.

name: Recycled Glass
description: Glass made from recycled glass products; infinitely recyclable and reduces need for new materials.

name: Bamboo Fiber
description: Natural fiber used in textiles and biodegradable plastics; renewable but requires chemicals for processing.

name: Laminated Wood
description: Engineered wood product used in construction; biodegradable but may contain adhesives.

name: Wool Felt
description: Compressed wool used in crafts and insulation; biodegradable and renewable.

name: Beryllium
description: Lightweight metal used in aerospace and electronics; toxic if inhaled and difficult to recycle.

name: Ceramic Tile
description: Durable material used in flooring and walls; non-biodegradable but recyclable in some cases.

name: Biodegradable Packing Peanuts
description: Packing material made from cornstarch; dissolves in water and compostable.

name: Graphene
description: Material with high electrical conductivity used in electronics and nanotechnology; recyclable but difficult to produce sustainably.

name: Pressed Wood
description: Wood product made from compressed wood particles, often used in furniture; biodegradable but may contain adhesives.

name: Titanium Alloy
description: High-strength metal alloy used in aerospace and medical implants; recyclable but resource-intensive.

name: Recycled Cotton
description: Textile fiber made from reused cotton; biodegradable and reduces need for new raw cotton.

name: Zinc Alloy
description: Metal alloy often used in automotive and construction parts; recyclable but mining can be harmful.

name: Bee Wax
description: Natural wax produced by bees, used in candles and cosmetics; renewable and biodegradable.

name: Sisal Fiber
description: Natural fiber used in ropes and textiles; biodegradable and renewable.

name: Foam Padding
description: Padding material used in the seat for comfort; typically made of polyurethane, which is non-biodegradable.

name: Nylon Screws
description: Plastic fasteners used in some parts of the chair; strong and resistant to wear, but non-biodegradable.

name: Powder Coating
description: Protective finish applied to the steel frame; adds durability and corrosion resistance, with minimal environmental impact.

name: Sunflower
description: The common sunflower is harvested for its edible oily seeds, which are often eaten as a snack food. They are also used in the production of cooking oil, as food for livestock, as bird food, and as a plantings in domestic gardens for aesthetics.
